info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 01 at 2:42AM EDT until July 01 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT/315 AM EDT/ FOR WARRICK...NORTHERN VANDERBURGH...SPENCER... SOUTHEASTERN GIBSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL PIKE COUNTIES... At 141 AM CDT/241 AM EDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Oakland City to 6 miles northwest of Chandler to Melody Hill, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. A 70 mph wind gust was measured in Darmstadt at 1:40 AM CDT. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Chandler around 150 AM CDT. Boonville, Newburgh and Lynnville around 155 AM CDT. Folsomville around 205 AM CDT. Dale around 215 AM CDT. Rockport, Grandview and Santa Claus around 220 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Chrisney, Mackey, Elberfeld, Somerville, Spurgeon, Tennyson and Gentryville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 7 and 31. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 24 and 56. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
